--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "d94dg" <d94dg@y...> wrote:
> I would like to be able to find out which tests that have stopped 
> working between two of our nightly builds (which run a set of JUnit 
> tests). Since we currently have more than 500 test cases it is 
> difficult to do this manually. It would of course be easy if the 
> normal success rate was 100%, but a number of test cases fail since 
> the implementation is not yet completed. 

I simply keep two kind of tests in separate directories of my source 
tree. One kind is testing existing completed code, which should 
always pass 100%. Another kind of tests are for not yet written code 
or not yet implemented behaviour. Those should fail, but less and 
less as you move more tests from failed category to completed. You 
can watch the number of tests failing from release to release.
